verses.verse: For the Chief Musician; set to the Gittith. A Psalm of Asaph. Sing aloud <WH7321> unto God <WH430> our strength <WH5797>: Make a joyful noise <WH7321> unto the God <WH430> of Jacob <WH3290>.
Raise <WH5375> a song <WH2172>, and bring <WH5414> hither the timbrel <WH8596>, The pleasant <WH5273> harp <WH3658> with the psaltery <WH5035>.
Blow <WH8628> the trumpet <WH7782> at the new moon <WH2320>, At the full moon <WH2320>, on our feast <WH2282> - day <WH3117>.
For it is a statute <WH2706> for Israel <WH3478>, An ordinance <WH4941> of the God <WH430> of Jacob <WH3290>.

He appointed <WH7760> it in Joseph <WH3084> for a testimony <WH5715>, When he went out <WH3318> over the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>, Where I heard <WH8085> a language <WH8193> that I knew not <WH3045>.
I removed <WH5493> his shoulder <WH7926> from the burden <WH5447>: His hands <WH3709> were freed <WH5674> from the basket <WH1731>.

Thou calledst <WH7121> in trouble <WH6869>, and I delivered <WH2502> thee <WH6030>; I answered thee in the secret place <WH5643> of thunder <WH7482>; I proved <WH974> thee at the waters <WH4325> of Meribah <WH4809>. <WH5542>[[Selah
Hear <WH8085>, O my people <WH5971>, and I will testify <WH5749> unto thee <WH3478>: O Israel, if thou wouldest hearken unto me <WH8085>!
There shall no strange <WH2114> god <WH410> be in thee <WH7812>; Neither shalt thou worship any foreign <WH5236> god <WH410>.
I am Jehovah <WH3068> thy God <WH430>, Who brought <WH5927> thee up out of the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>: Open thy mouth <WH6310> wide <WH7337>, and I will fill it <WH4390>.
But my people <WH5971> hearkened <WH8085> not to my voice <WH6963>; And Israel <WH3478> would none of me <WH14>.
So I let them go <WH7971> after the stubbornness <WH8307> of their heart <WH3820>, That they might walk <WH3212> in their own counsels <WH4156>.
Oh <WH3863> that my people <WH5971> would hearken <WH8085> unto me <WH3478>, That Israel would walk <WH1980> in my ways <WH1870>!
I would soon <WH4592> subdue <WH3665> their enemies <WH341>, And turn <WH7725> my hand <WH3027> against their adversaries <WH341>.
The haters <WH8130> of Jehovah <WH3068> should submit <WH3584> themselves unto him <WH6256>: But their time should endure for ever <WH5769>.
He would feed <WH398> them also with the finest <WH2459> of the wheat <WH2406>; And with honey <WH1706> out of the rock <WH6697> would I satisfy thee <WH7646>.
